patterns.pattern: (royal bank of canada|\bRBC\b|td canada trust|scotiabank|bank of montreal|\bBMO\b|cibc).*suspicious (activity|transaction)
patterns.description: Warns of suspicious activity on your account — real banks use verified short codes, not random messages.
Claims your account is locked or suspended — designed to create panic.
Asks you to verify identity by clicking a link — real banks direct you to their app.

patterns.pattern: share the (security|verification|one-time|one time|2fa) code.*we just sent you
patterns.description: Asks for your one-time security code — your bank will never ask for this.

patterns.pattern: to (secure|protect) your account, please complete this transaction
patterns.description: Asks you to complete a transaction to 'protect' your account — banks don't do this.
RBC-branded phishing asking to verify or update your login credentials.
